suncertify.db

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.db.Data
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DB, DBPlusQuery

    public class Data
extends java.lang.Object
implements DB, DBPlusQuery
    Singleton that acts as a cache between the user(s) and the database file, and implements the business logic use cases.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Data getInstance()
        Accesses the Singleton's object of this class. The creation of the singleton is made in a thread-safe, lazy way.
        Returns:
        the Singleton's object of this class

      • getList

        public static java.util.List<CustomerRecord> getList()
        Accesses the object-oriented customer records stored in cache, filters those marked as valid records, and returns them in a data structure.
        Returns:
        a data structure containing valid, object-oriented customer records
        See Also:
        DBSchema.VALID_RECORD

      • setList

        public static void setList(DBDML fileDML)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the cache, in a thread-safe way, doing nothing when the cache is already populated.

        If logging is enabled, and an attempt is made to re-populate the cache, a warning message is logged to the console.

        Parameters:
        fileDML - the delegate that maps from bytes to objects to bytes
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's an error while accessing the customer records bytes

      • getDbDML

        public static DBDML getDbDML()
        Accesses the delegate that maps from bytes to objects to bytes.
        Returns:
        the delegate that maps from bytes to objects to bytes

      • read

        public java.lang.String[] read(int recNo)
                        throws RecordNotFoundException
        Reads a record from the file. Returns an array where each element is a record value. If logging is enabled and the operation succeeds, a message is logged to the console.

        A record is considered not found, if the record number doesn't exist, or if it exists, but the matching record is deemed as deleted.

        Specified by:
        read in interface DB
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number pertaining to a client company
        Returns:
        a data structure containing the state of the client company
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        See Also:
        DBSchema.DELETED_RECORD

      • update

        public void update(int recNo,
                   java.lang.String[] data,
                   long lockCookie)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException,
                   BookingException
        Modifies the fields of a record. The new value for field n appears in data[n]. If logging is enabled and the operation succeeds, a message is logged to the console.

        A record is considered not found, if the record number doesn't exist, or if it exists, but the matching record is deemed as deleted.

        If the input data structure contains a non-blank customer id, and the customer record matching the input record number, already has a non-blank customer id, a BookingException is thrown.

        Before updating the customer record, it compares the input lockcookie with the "lockcookie" stored in memory for the customer record matching the input record number, and if they mismatch, a SecurityException is thrown.

        Specified by:
        update in interface DB
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number pertaining to a client company
        data - the new state of the client company
        lockCookie - the id security token that locked the record number
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie
        BookingException - if it tries to book a client when that client is already booked
        See Also:
        DBSchema.DELETED_RECORD, DBSchema.CUSTOMER_HOLDING_THIS_RECORD

      • delete

        public void delete(int recNo,
                   long lockCookie)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException
        Deletes a record, making the record number and associated disk storage available for reuse. If logging is enabled and the operation succeeds, a message is logged to the console.

        A record is considered not found, if the record number doesn't exist, or if it exists, but the matching record is deemed as deleted.

        Before deleting the customer record, it compares the input lockcookie with the "lockcookie" stored in memory for the customer record matching the input record number, and if they mismatch, a SecurityException is thrown.

        Specified by:
        delete in interface DB
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number pertaining to a client company
        lockCookie - the id security token that locked the record number
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie
        See Also:
        DBSchema.DELETED_RECORD

      • find

        public int[] find(java.lang.String[] criteria)
        Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".) If logging is enabled and the operation succeeds, a message is logged to the console.

        It excludes from the search those customer records that are deemed as deleted.

        Specified by:
        find in interface DB
        Parameters:
        criteria - the data structure that contains the search criteria
        Returns:
        a data structure that contains the records numbers that match the criteria
        See Also:
        DBSchema.DELETED_RECORD

      • findByNameAndLocation

        public int[] findByNameAndLocation(java.lang.String[] criteria)
        Searches for matching record numbers on the basis of name and location. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that has an exact match on criteria[n]. (For example, "Philarmonic Remodeling" matches "Philharmonic Remodeling"). If logging is enabled and the operation succeeds, a message is logged to the console.

        It excludes from the search those customer records that are deemed as deleted.

        Specified by:
        findByNameAndLocation in interface DBPlusQuery
        Parameters:
        criteria - the data structure that contains the search criteria
        Returns:
        a data structure that contains the record numbers that match the criteria
        See Also:
        DBSchema.DELETED_RECORD

      • create

        public int create(java.lang.String[] data)
           throws DuplicateKeyException
        Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry). Inserts the given data, and returns the record number of the new record. If logging is enabled and the operation succeeds a message is logged to the console.

        A DuplicateKeyException is thrown if one of the object- oriented customer records in cache, already contains simultaneously a matching subcontractor name and city with those of the input data structure, and that record is deemed as valid.

        It excludes from the search those customer records that are deemed as deleted.

        Specified by:
        create in interface DB
        Parameters:
        data - the data structure that contains the new record state
        Returns:
        the record number of the new record
        Throws:
        DuplicateKeyException - if the client company name and geographical location already exists in memory
        See Also:
        DBSchema.DELETED_RECORD, DBSchema.VALID_RECORD, CustomerRecord, DBSchema.SUBCONTRACTOR_NAME, DBSchema.CITY

      • lock

        public long lock(int recNo)
          throws RecordNotFoundException
        Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

        A RecordNotFoundException is thrown, if the record number doesn't exist.

        Specified by:
        lock in interface DB
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number to lock
        Returns:
        an identification security token
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory

      • unlock

        public void unlock(int recNo,
                   long cookie)
            throws RecordNotFoundException,
                   java.lang.SecurityException
        Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException.

        A RecordNotFoundException is thrown, if the record number doesn't exist.

        Specified by:
        unlock in interface DB
        Parameters:
        recNo - the record number to unlock
        cookie - the identification security token
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if there is no such record in memory
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the record is locked with a cookie other than lockCookie
